[Root.GetTitledFirstName] rules a restored Imperium Romanum, but much work remains to be done. There is still territory to recover and ancient borders to reclaim. For the Senate and People of Rome!

column2: Traditionally, the power of the [Root.GetEmperorName] comes from the Pope, who confirms [Root.GetHerHis] authority with an official coronation. However, your faith prevents you from seeing the Pope as a legitimate authority, meaning that you cannot officially call yourself [Root.GetEmperorName]. It is possible that you could declare the creation of a new Empire with all the precedents of the old, but there is a chance some of your vassals might use such an opportunity to consider your rule illegitimate and declare independence...

To [Root.GetHerHisCap] Majesty [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
In the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], would like to inform you that I deem you are not yet worthy and just enough as a ruler to be offered my blessings to become crowned as the Roman Emperor. The Lord surely has much faith in you as you have in him, but remember that the honour of receiving His blessing does not come easy and is only for the purest of souls.
Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: My [Root.GetLordLady] [Root.GetFirstName],\nIt is my position that the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is a legacy deserving of the likes of Charlemagne, and requires a ruler of sufficient substance and character to earn its support. I believe that ruler is not you, and thus the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] hereby declares its independence from the empire. We will find our own way from this day on.\n[From.GetTitledName]

The Pope has refused to anoint you with his blessing, and indeed there are far too many who consider the throne to exist only in name. To them, you claim of the imperial title is meaningless. The once-great empire of Charlemagne has fallen to chaos.
